title: Indonesian Community Web-Portal
description:
* カルダノに関する信頼できるインドネシア語のウェブ/ポータルがない。
* インドネシア人の英語能力の低さ
* 散在するコミュニティSPO

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great low cost proposal by people involved in the Indonesian Cardano community to provide local language resources for them. It is a short duration project, success in which will allow then to gain funding in the next round to get them to the level where they can become self sustaining. Overall a well set out and well deserving proposal from  a group that has already put time and effort into their local community.
f6_assessments.q1: There is a clear plan to get things going with this small funding request by the founder of a local Indonesian Cardano community.
f6_assessments.q2: There are clear timelines and deliverables which make this easy to audit. The prosper has asked for a small amount of funds to get this going and then will come back next round. Thus this is very low risk for the community, as if the first step fails, we don't fund the second. The plan has clear metrics and goals against which success can be measured.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal utilizes website to accommodate the needs of information about Cardano in Indonesian language. It will bring some benefits, such as: giving more information about events, update, list of Indonesian SPOs, official chanel (Cardano Forum, Telegram, Instagram, etc.) of Indonesian Community. This will be another stepping stone for Indonesian community to grow & reach more people via dedicated website in Indonesian language.
f6_assessments.q1: I agree, that based on the team experiences (business development & web design), they could achieve the end-result properly. But I would love to know more about the detail of the deliverables. Preferably mockup design of the website would be nice.
f6_assessments.q2: There are plenty information provided, but the plan still lacks detail such as what will be the end-result looks like (mockup, domain name, what is the content of the website, etc.). Adding more detail on project planning would be great, such as: how long does it take to design the UI/UX of the web, developing the website, hosting, adding content, and so on. It would make the auditor/community can easily compare the project plan with the result.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer identified the problem that there is no reliable cardano web portal in Indonesia associated with the low English proficiency of Indonesians. He presented as a solution the creation of a web portal about Cardano for the Indonesian Cardano Community. The proposer gives metrics to assess performance but I think there is more to be assessed, such as the number of hits to the site, for example. The project presented this proposal as the first phase out of 3, clarifying that the last one will not need funding, so there is still no way to assess whether it will be financially sustainable in the future
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer did not present any evidence of his abilities but claimed to have relevant experience to implement the project. The proposer has identified the number of team members who will implement the work. The budget is reasonable and well detailed. The proposer presents a realistic deadline for completing the work. The proposer does not give a plan of how the work will be carried out but gives key metrics.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer gives KPIs to enable proposal auditability. However, it does not have a roadmap or milestones. The evaluation of the number of accesses to the web portal would be interesting to assess the impact of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
Yes. The language barrier should be lowered with solutions that bring content in many languages.


Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
 Yes

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Yes
 

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
 Yes

Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
 Yes

Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
 Yes


This proposal will definitely positively impact the Indonesian populace as well as overall improve the Cardano community.  it addresses a valid problem

Yes he has listed team members and some links

Yes

I have visited the links.

No

Yes

Yes

Yes

Is budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
Seems  reasonable

Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
No plan for additional funds 

Have you verified this plan?
No 


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
Yes

Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
Yes

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Yes
 
Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
Yes

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
No
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
Yes


Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
Yes
 

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
Yes
 

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Yes


Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
Yes

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
No plan given

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
No 

  
This project can  be recommended

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal presents a clear, step-by-step plan for providing for making Cardano information available in Bahasa Indonesia (the official language of Indonesia, and a version of Malay). Given the large population of Indonesia (~275 million) this is proposal offers the opportunity for substantial expansion of access to Cardano. It also offers a broader vision for building a Cardano community in Indonesia.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is for a straightforward plan to develop a local web portal for Cardano in Indonesia, and clearly appears achievable. However, there are two questions that I have regarding implementation. First, and more important, there is little detail about the expected content of the web portal. It says the portal will be "everything about Cardano", which is not possible. The idea seems to be to have a place where anything about Cardano can be posted, but more detail and organization would be desirable. Depending upon portal content, additional skills may be needed for the team (and there is no budget for content development). Second, the core team includes a web designer (Toma) but not apparently a web developer. However, such skills are easily purchased and there is a clear budget for this -- so this is not a significant concern. Given these issues, I agree but do not strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: For similar reasons to those on the feasibility/implementation criterion, audit of delivery could be somewhat challenging. On the one hand, it will  easily be possible to verify that the web portal has been delivered, and in theory possible to assess the content of the web portal qualitatively (although it will be in Indonesian, which makes this challenging for English-speaking assessors). On the other hand, without detail of what the portal will include, audit may be challenging. So it depends what is being audited. The KPI provided regarding search ranking and onboarding may be good measures of success -- i.e. accepting the votes of the crowd (and Google) whether this is a good portal or not. Considering these factors I agree but do not strongly agree that the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses not only the lack of resources in Bahasa, but also the need to make them easy to understand, navigable, and appealingly designed, which will increase impact. The idea of a "one-stop portal" is important – even in English, info is very scattered, which can cause confusion, so the idea of bringing all the Bahasa resources together will help ensure the info is used. The need for the project is well supported by detail on the low English proficiency in Indonesia; and the proposal shows a clear knowledge of the specific situation in Indonesia and how to address it. Also the fact that this is not a translation project, but instead aims to engage the Indonesian community to create content that is relevant to them, suggests that it will be impactful.
f6_assessments.q1: The team are embedded in the Indonesian Cardano community, and have the contacts and skills (including the design skills, which often seem to be a bit overlooked in Catalyst!) to deliver the project. Their budget is well worked out, and their time plan is clear and achievable, and includes a clear knowledge of who their main stakeholders are.
f6_assessments.q2: There are some milestones suggested (things such as the web portal going live) – but most of these are not really KPIs and can't really help us audit how well the project is doing what it does; so there is a need to include a few more metrics (e.g. how many people are using the portal; what's the bounce rate like; etc; and ideally, something about levels of community contribution, e.g. how many people are writing or translating content; how engaged were they already or has the project actually supported new people to get involved, etc). The project will collect some useful qualitative evaluation material, e.g. from feedback from SPOs, and via the regular community virtual meetup; but how will it be collected, stored, and shared?. In short, the project can be audited to some extent, but it's not clear whether it's quite enough.

solution: インドネシアのカルダノコミュニティがサポートする、シンプルな言語でわかりやすいコンテンツを持つバハサ・インドネシアのウェブポータルを構築する。
experience:
* ビジネスディベロップメント
* プロジェクトマネージャー
* ローカルコミュニティ創設者
* グラフィックデザイナー
* イラストレーター
* ウェブ開発者
